Appearance & Reality

Parmenides’ Challenge

  • Required reading
    • ‘On Nature’, Parmenides
  • Optional reading
    • ‘Presocratic Themes’, D. Sedley
    • ‘Parmenides’, SEP entry
  • Optional videos
    • Susan Sauve Meyer on Parmenides’ Prohibition
    • Susan Suave Meyer on Parmenides’ vs change
  • Notes
    • Lecture notes

Responses to Parmenides

  • Required reading
    • Physics, Book 1, Aristotle. Chapter 2 & 3 are very difficult. Do your best and don’t get dismayed. The most important chapters are 7 & 8, which are fairly straightforward.
    • ‘The Eleatic Challenge in Aristotle’s Physics 1.8’, S. O’Connor
  • Optional reading
    • Aristotle, selections, C. Shields
    • ‘The Subjects of Natural Generations in Aristotle’s Physics 1.7’, S. O’Connor
  • Optional video
    • Susan Suave Meyer on Empedocles
    • Susan Suave Meyer on other presocratics
  • Notes
    • Lecture Notes: These are in draft form. I will edit and complete after our meeting on Wednseday.

Assignments

  • Short essay 1: each of the 7 modules contains a short essay. You must complete 5 of these over the semester. If you complete more than 5, I will drop the lowest grades. See the syllabus for full details on due dates, requirements, etc.
